Dear President Donald John Trump,

I come from Hong Kong. I was only a little kid when I first saw you, on the show ‘The Apprentice’. I thought ‘this rich dude is charmingly eccentric’. To be honest, I used to mixed you up with Richard Branson.

Many years laters, I heard you name again all over the news when you announced that you would run for 2016 Presidency. At that time many people mocked you, but I had a strong feeling that you were going to win. I even made a bet with my friend that you would be the President of The United States, come to think of it, I made some money because of you.

Witnessing your path to the Presidency was truly wonderful. Your speeches, which many criticized (unfairly), somehow touched me. Your unorthodoxy inspired me. Your courage to take on the MSM moved me.

Your Presidency amazes me and many around me.
You have kept all your election promises, made tremendous accomplishment and taken a strong stand against the tyranny in the world. All the while being treated so unfairly. I just want you know that me and many other in Hong Kong are rooting for you.

America used to be only be a vague mixture of freedom, high tach, fast food and guns. You have painted a vivid picture of America to me; all its greatness and flaws; a country I want to be in. I only regret that I am not a US citizen so I could not vote for you in this election.

May you continue to trump in your future. God bless America and the Free World

Yours truly,
A man from Hong Kong

quote.msg:
Dear President Donald John Trump,

I come from Hong Kong. I was only a little kid when I first saw you, on the show ‘The Apprentice’. I thought ‘this rich dude is charmingly eccentric’. To be honest, I used to mixed you up with Richard Branson.

Many years laters, I heard you name again all over the news when you announced that you would run for 2016 Presidency. At that time many people mocked you, but I had a strong feeling that you were going to win. I even made a bet with my friend that you would be the President of The United States, come to think of it, I made some money because of you.

Witnessing your path to the Presidency was truly wonderful. Your speeches, which many criticized (unfairly), somehow touched me. Your unorthodoxy inspired me. Your courage to take on the MSM moved me.

Your Presidency amazes me and many around me.
You have kept all your election promises, made tremendous accomplishment and taken a strong stand against the tyranny in the world. All the while being treated so unfairly. I just want you know that me and many other in Hong Kong are rooting for you.

America used to be only be a vague mixture of freedom, high tach, fast food and guns. You have painted a vivid picture of America to me; all its greatness and flaws; a country I want to be in. I only regret that I am not a US citizen so I could not vote for you in this election.

May you continue to trump in your future. God bless America and the Free World

Yours truly,
A man from Hong Kong

Dear President Donald John Trump,

I come from Hong Kong. I was only a little kid when I first saw you, on the show ‘The Apprentice’. I thought ‘this rich dude is charmingly eccentric’. To be honest, I used to mixed you up with Richard Branson.

Many years laters, I heard you name again all over the news when you announced that you would run for 2016 Presidency. At that time many people mocked you, but I had a strong feeling that you were going to win. I even made a bet with my friend that you would be the President of The United States, come to think of it, I made some money because of you.

Witnessing your path to the Presidency was truly wonderful. Your speeches, which many criticized (unfairly), somehow touched me. Your unorthodoxy inspired me. Your courage to take on the MSM moved me.

Your Presidency amazes me and many around me.
You have kept all your election promises, made tremendous accomplishment and taken a strong stand against the tyranny in the world. All the while being treated so unfairly. I just want you know that me and many other in Hong Kong are rooting for you.

America used to be only be a vague mixture of freedom, high tach, fast food and guns. You have painted a vivid picture of America to me; all its greatness and flaws; a country I want to be in. I only regret that I am not a US citizen so I could not vote for you in this election.

May you continue to trump in your future. God bless America and the Free World

Yours truly,
A man from Hong Kong
